xyz.acygn.mokapot

Interface CommunicationAddress

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Copiable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    LoopbackCommunicationAddress, SiteLocalCommunicationAddress, StaticInternetCommunicationAddress, TCPCommunicationAddress

    public interface CommunicationAddress
extends Copiable
    Information allowing a particular VM involved in a distributed computation to be contacted.

    This is very similar in most ways to a socket address, but has the added requirement of transitivity; if virtual machine A can connect to virtual machine B via CommunicationAddress addressB, and A can connect to C via CommunicationAddress addressC, then B must also be able to connect to C via CommunicationAddress addressC.

    This interface is very general, and does not make assumptions about the method via which connections to the machine in question are made. However, given that reliable communication is required and communication will in most cases be performed over a network, most uses of this system are likely to use TCP. In that case, see TCPCommunicationAddress and its subclasses for an existing implementation.

    Author:
    Alex Smith
    See Also:
    TCPCommunicationAddress

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean compatibleWithAddress(CommunicationAddress address)
      Checks to see whether another communication address can potentially exist in the same distributed computation as this address.
      boolean equals(Object obj)
      Returns true if and only if the given Object represents the same address as this communication address.
      ServerSocket newListenSocket()
      Creates a new ServerSocket that allows this machine to listen for connections from other machines that are sent via this address.
      Socket newSendSocket()
      Opens a new connection to the virtual machine at this communication address, and returns a socket via which information can be sent to it.

    • Method Detail

      • newSendSocket

        Socket newSendSocket()
              throws IOException
        Opens a new connection to the virtual machine at this communication address, and returns a socket via which information can be sent to it.
        Returns:
        An open, connected socket, such that information written to the socket will be sent to the machine at this communication address.
        Throws:
        IOException - If something goes wrong trying to establish communications

      • newListenSocket

        ServerSocket newListenSocket()
                      throws IOException
        Creates a new ServerSocket that allows this machine to listen for connections from other machines that are sent via this address. Obviously, this should only be called if this communication address refers to the local virtual machine.
        Returns:
        A server socket that will be capable of receiving communications that are sent via this address. The socket is initially bound, but not listening.
        Throws:
        IOException - If something goes wrong trying to create the socket

      • compatibleWithAddress

        boolean compatibleWithAddress(CommunicationAddress address)
        Checks to see whether another communication address can potentially exist in the same distributed computation as this address.

        In many cases, it's obvious simply by inspecting two addresses that they can't possibly be compatible with each other; for example, an address that specifies that connections should be made to "the local machine" cannot coexist with an address that specifies that connections should be made over a network, as "the local machine" would have a different meaning to each computer on the network (and thus the machines involved in the computation would disagree about what one of the addresses referred to). This method is used to give clearer error messages in cases where it's easy to determine that at least one of the addresses involved is incorrect.

        Parameters:
        address - The address to check this address for compatibility with.
        Returns:
        true if it's reasonable for this address and address to coexist in the same computation; false otherwise.

      • equals

        boolean equals(Object obj)
        Returns true if and only if the given Object represents the same address as this communication address. It's necessary to ensure that if a communication object is cloned (e.g. by serializing and deserializing it), then it will compare equal to the original. (Remember to also override the hashCode in a consistent way!)
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object
        Parameters:
        obj - The object to compare to. If this is not a communication address, the comparison will return false.
        Returns:
        Whether the two objects are equal.
        See Also:
        Object.hashCode()
